00297 
00298 #ifndef _STRINGUTIL_H_   // avoid clash with similar defs in common/stringutil.h
00299 
00300 inline char *opp_strcpy(char *s1,const char *s2)
00301 {
00302     return strcpy(s1, s2 ? s2 : "");
00303 }
00304 
00305 inline int opp_strlen(const char *s)
00306 {
00307     return s ? strlen(s) : 0;
00308 }
00309 
00310 inline char *opp_strdup(const char *s)
00311 {
00312     if (!s || !s[0]) return NULL;
00313     char *p = new char[strlen(s)+1];
00314     strcpy(p,s);
00315     return p;
00316 }
00317 
00318 inline int opp_strcmp(const char *s1, const char *s2)
00319 {
00320     if (s1)
00321         return s2 ? strcmp(s1,s2) : (*s1 ? 1 : 0);
00322     else
00323         return (s2 && *s2) ? -1 : 0;
00324 }
00325 
00326 #endif //_STRINGUTIL_H_
00327 
00328 // internally used: appends [num] to the given string
00329 inline void opp_appendindex(char *s, unsigned int i)
00330 {
00331    while (*s) s++;
00332    *s++ = '[';
00333    if (i<10)
00334        {*s++ = '0'+i; *s++=']'; *s=0; return;}
00335    if (i<100)
00336        {*s++ = '0'+i/10; *s++='0'+i%10; *s++=']'; *s=0; return;}
00337    sprintf(s,"%d]",i);
00338 }
00339 
00340 inline long double_to_long(double d)
00341 {
00342     // gcc feature: if double d=0xc0000000, (long)d yields 0x80000000 !
00343     // This only happens with long: unsigned long is OK.
00344     // This causes trouble if we in fact want to cast this long to unsigned long, see NED_expr_2.test.
00345     // Workaround follows. Note: even the ul variable is needed: when inlining it, gcc will do the wrong cast!
00346     long l = (long)d;
00347     unsigned long ul = (unsigned long)d;
00348     return d<0 ? l : ul;
00349 }
00350 
00351 // internal
00352 inline std::string double_to_str(double t)
00353 {
00354    char buf[32];
00355    return gcvt(t,16,buf);
00356 }
